oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ex-President Johnson broadside
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside reads, "Ex-President Johnson Has accepted an invitation to address the people of Lincoln County, at Fayetteville, On Tuesday, July 13th 1869. Come hear him! Printed at the Observer Office, Fayetteville, Tenn."

Former President Andrew Johnson toured many Tennessee cities after he left the Presidency in an attempt to garner support for his nomination as United States Senator. The General Assembly did re-elect Johnson to the U.S. Senate in 1874, making him the only former U.S. President to return to the Senate; however, Johnson died after only four months in office.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875; Speeches, addresses, etc.
